definitions.definition: To rewrite existing source code in order to improve its readability, reusability or structure without affecting its meaning or behaviour.
definitions.example: The code works, but I must refactor it before it is production quality.

definitions.definition: (writing) To rewrite existing text in order to improve its readability, reusability or structure without intentionally affecting its meaning. Similar to, but sometimes involving more extensive restructuring than, copy editing.
definitions.example: Two significant activities which to contribute to community projects, such as Wikipedia, are to refactor complicated articles into simpler ones, and to refactor duplicated content into reusable templates.

definitions.definition: An act or process in which code is refactored.
